title: Reliance on a Single Factor in a Security Decision
overview: A protection mechanism relies exclusively, or to a large extent, on the evaluation of a single condition or the integrity of a single object or entity in order to make a decision about granting access to restricted resources or functionality.
remediation: ::PHASE:Architecture and Design:STRATEGY::EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:Use multiple simultaneous checks before granting access to critical operations or granting critical privileges. A weaker but helpful mitigation is to use several successive checks (multiple layers of security).::PHASE:Architecture and Design:STRATEGY::EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:Use redundant access rules on different choke points (e.g., firewalls).::
